title: Chasing an Economic Boom, White House Dismisses Risks of A.I.
summary: The administration has downplayed concerns — from mass job losses, to a potential financial bubble — as President Trump cheers soaring stock prices and faster growth.

title: DOJ Releases Another Batch of Epstein Files: Key Takeaways
summary: The new documents — nearly 30,000 in all — contain hundreds of references to President Trump and include different versions of Jeffrey Epstein’s will.

title: Redacted Material in Some Epstein Files Is Easily Recovered
summary: The ease of recovering information that was not properly redacted digitally suggests that at least some of the documents released by the Justice Department were hastily censored.

title: Pro-Trump Influencers Stay Conspicuously Quiet About Epstein Files
summary: Their silence contrasted with the uproar made over the weekend when the Justice Department’s first release focused on former President Bill Clinton.

title: Zelensky Opens Way to Demilitarized Zone in Eastern Ukraine to Reach Peace
summary: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.

title: Blast Kills Three in Moscow Near Site of General’s Car Bombing
summary: Two police officers died in the explosion, the authorities said. Earlier this week a car bomb killed a military commander in the same area of Russia’s capital.

title: A Father and Son’s $108 Billion Hostile Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Larry and David Ellison didn’t always have a close relationship. Now they’re one of the most intriguing partnerships in business.

title: Pulled ’60 Minutes’ Report, Briefly Streamed in Canada, Is All Over the Internet Now
summary: At the last minute, CBS News held a segment about Venezuelan men who were deported by the Trump administration to a prison in El Salvador. It surfaced online anyway.

title: Trump’s Tanker Crackdown Paralyzes Venezuelan Oil Exports
summary: Oil exports, the country’s financial lifeblood, have plummeted after the United States took action against three ships that have been used to carry its crude.

title: U.S. Is Adding to Its Military Buildup in the Caribbean
summary: Over the past week, C-17 heavy-lift cargo planes, which usually transport troops and equipment, flew to Puerto Rico at least 16 times, according to flight tracking data reviewed by The New York Times.

title: The Deposed Assad Henchmen Plotting to Retake Syria
summary: Hacked communications and a social media analysis reveal how former regime leaders are trying to arm fighters and exert influence as far away as Washington.

title: After the Assad Regime’s Fall, His Enforcers Are Lying Low and Living Large
summary: A Times investigation into the whereabouts of top Syrian officials who fled after the regime’s fall shows many remain free — shielded by wealth and accommodating host nations.

title: The Truce Is 2 Months Old. So Why Have Hundreds of Gazans Been Killed?
summary: Since the cease-fire took effect, Israel says it has targeted only militants. But death can come for Gazans while on a family outing or sleeping in a tent.

title: Suspect in Brown University Shooting Worked in Portugal After Leaving University
summary: One friend said Claudio Neves Valente appeared to live a detached life, upset that “he couldn’t be the genius he thought he should be.”

title: ICE Sweeps Into Ohio, Stirring Fear Among Somalis and Other Immigrants
summary: After Mayor Andrew Ginther of Columbus said that its policy prohibited local cooperation on immigration enforcement, Elon Musk called him a “traitor.”

title: Palm Beach Rallies Behind a Restaurant Manager Held at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
summary: After nearly two weeks in detention, José Gonzalez, the popular host of an upscale restaurant, returns home.

title: Lawmaker Returns to Migrant Center Where She Clashed With U.S. Agents
summary: Representative LaMonica McIver, a New Jersey Democrat, called on immigration officials to close Delaney Hall in Newark, calling detainees’ food and medical care inadequate.

title: Pennsylvania Nursing Home Explosion Kills 2
summary: A resident and an employee were killed after two explosions at the Bristol Health and Rehab Center resulted in a large fire and partial collapse of the building, officials said.

title: Investors Warn of ‘Rot in Private Equity’ as Funds Strike Circular Deals
summary: Buyout firms have struggled to sell companies they own and have instead found a workaround to get cash back to clients: Selling the companies to themselves.

title: $100 for a Cab to the Airport? It May Soon Get Worse.
summary: The Port Authority is preparing to increase the charge for drivers to pick up and drop off passengers at the airports.

title: Mamdani Names Fire Commissioner, but Comments From the Former One Linger
summary: Zohran Mamdani chose Lillian Bonsignore to be fire commissioner, weeks after the former commissioner, Robert S. Tucker, resigned, citing Mr. Mamdani’s views on Israel.

title: A Democrat, a Republican and a Supermarket Baron Go to ‘Marty Supreme’
summary: A “Marty Supreme” showing took a political turn when John Catsimatidis, who has a small role in the movie, invited both Gov. Kathy Hochul and her Republican rival, Bruce Blakeman.

title: ‘Stranger Things’ Creators Break Down Their Latest Influences
summary: With a new batch of episodes arriving on Christmas Day, Matt and Ross Duffer discuss the sometimes obscure movie and video game references in the final season so far.

title: The Year America Blew Up the Process
summary: The 2025 revolt against process signaled the final collapse of a powerful idea that once promised to hold the country together.

title: A Christmas Argument That Ended in Harmony
summary: Standing together on behalf of those who flee oppression is a very Christmas thing to do.

title: Inside the Oval Office
summary: Today we take a look at President Trump’s interior design.

title: China Is Shifting Its Nuclear Forces to Swifter Footing, Pentagon Says
summary: The country’s production of nuclear warheads has slowed, but its missiles may be poised to strike back fast in case of an attack, an annual assessment found.

title: Australian State Passes ‘Extraordinary’ Gun and Protest Laws After Bondi Attack
summary: While the new restrictions on firearms have broad support, new police powers to crack down on some protests were criticized as limits on civil liberties.

title: In Pursuit of the Monarch’s Magnetic Sense
summary: The magnetic compass is the last unknown sense in migrating animals. For some scientists, the monarch butterfly is leading the way.

title: Thailand, Attacking Cambodia, Says Its Target Is the Scam Industry
summary: Thai warplanes have bombed compounds where people are forced to defraud others online. Rights activists say trafficking victims’ lives are at risk.
